members.name: getName
members.comment: Returns the name of this theme.

members.name: getPrimary1
members.comment: Returns the primary 1 color.

members.name: getPrimary2
members.comment: Returns the primary 2 color.

members.name: getPrimary3
members.comment: Returns the primary 3 color.

members.name: getSecondary1
members.comment: Returns the secondary 1 color.

members.name: getSecondary2
members.comment: Returns the secondary 2 color.

members.name: getSecondary3
members.comment: Returns the secondary 3 color.

members.name: getControlTextFont
members.comment: Returns the control text font.

members.name: getSystemTextFont
members.comment: Returns the system text font.

members.name: getUserTextFont
members.comment: Returns the user text font.

members.name: getMenuTextFont
members.comment: Returns the menu text font.

members.name: getWindowTitleFont
members.comment: Returns the window title font.

members.name: getSubTextFont
members.comment: Returns the sub-text font.

members.name: getWhite
members.comment: Returns the white color. This returns opaque white (0xFFFFFFFF).

members.name: getBlack
members.comment: Returns the black color. This returns opaque black (0xFF000000).

members.name: getFocusColor
members.comment: Returns the focus color. This returns the value of getPrimary2().

members.name: getDesktopColor
members.comment: Returns the desktop color. This returns the value of getPrimary2().

members.name: getControl
members.comment: Returns the control color. This returns the value of getSecondary3().

members.name: getControlShadow
members.comment: Returns the control shadow color. This returns the value of getSecondary2().

members.name: getControlDarkShadow
members.comment: Returns the control dark shadow color. This returns the value of getSecondary1().

members.name: getControlInfo
members.comment: Returns the control info color. This returns the value of getBlack().

members.name: getControlHighlight
members.comment: Returns the control highlight color. This returns the value of getWhite().

members.name: getControlDisabled
members.comment: Returns the control disabled color. This returns the value of getSecondary2().

members.name: getPrimaryControl
members.comment: Returns the primary control color. This returns the value of getPrimary3().

members.name: getPrimaryControlShadow
members.comment: Returns the primary control shadow color. This returns the value of getPrimary2().

members.name: getPrimaryControlDarkShadow
members.comment: Returns the primary control dark shadow color. This returns the value of getPrimary1().

return: the primary control dark shadow color

members.name: getPrimaryControlInfo
members.comment: Returns the primary control info color. This returns the value of getBlack().

members.name: getPrimaryControlHighlight
members.comment: Returns the primary control highlight color. This returns the value of getWhite().

members.name: getSystemTextColor
members.comment: Returns the system text color. This returns the value of getBlack().

members.name: getControlTextColor
members.comment: Returns the control text color. This returns the value of getControlInfo().

members.name: getInactiveControlTextColor
members.comment: Returns the inactive control text color. This returns the value of getControlDisabled().

members.name: getInactiveSystemTextColor
members.comment: Returns the inactive system text color. This returns the value of getSecondary2().

members.name: getUserTextColor
members.comment: Returns the user text color. This returns the value of getBlack().

members.name: getTextHighlightColor
members.comment: Returns the text highlight color. This returns the value of getPrimary3().

members.name: getHighlightedTextColor
members.comment: Returns the highlighted text color. This returns the value of getControlTextColor().

members.name: getWindowBackground
members.comment: Returns the window background color. This returns the value of getWhite().

members.name: getWindowTitleBackground
members.comment: Returns the window title background color. This returns the value of getPrimary3().

members.name: getWindowTitleForeground
members.comment: Returns the window title foreground color. This returns the value of getBlack().

members.comment: Returns the window title inactive background color. This returns the value of getSecondary3().

return: the window title inactive background color

members.name: getWindowTitleInactiveForeground
members.comment: Returns the window title inactive foreground color. This returns the value of getBlack().

return: the window title inactive foreground color

members.comment: Returns the menu background color. This returns the value of getSecondary3().

members.comment: Returns the menu foreground color. This returns the value of getBlack().

members.comment: Returns the menu selected background color. This returns the value of getPrimary2().

members.name: getMenuSelectedForeground
members.comment: Returns the menu selected foreground color. This returns the value of getBlack().

members.name: getMenuDisabledForeground
members.comment: Returns the menu disabled foreground color. This returns the value of getSecondary2().

members.name: getSeparatorBackground
members.comment: Returns the separator background color. This returns the value of getWhite().

members.name: getSeparatorForeground
members.comment: Returns the separator foreground color. This returns the value of getPrimary1().

members.name: getAcceleratorForeground
members.comment: Returns the accelerator foreground color. This returns the value of getPrimary1().

members.name: getAcceleratorSelectedForeground
members.comment: Returns the accelerator selected foreground color. This returns the value of getBlack().

members.name: addCustomEntriesToTable
members.comment: Adds values specific to this theme to the defaults table. This method is invoked when the look and feel defaults are obtained from MetalLookAndFeel. This implementation does nothing; it is provided for subclasses that wish to customize the defaults table.

param: table - the UIDefaults to add the values to

members.comment: Constructor for subclasses to call.

name: javax.swing.plaf.metal.MetalTheme
comment:
MetalTheme provides the color palette and fonts used by the Java Look and Feel.

MetalTheme is abstract, see DefaultMetalTheme and OceanTheme for concrete implementations.

MetalLookAndFeel maintains the current theme that the the ComponentUI implementations for metal use. Refer to MetalLookAndFeel.setCurrentTheme(MetalTheme) for details on changing the current theme.

MetalTheme provides a number of public methods for getting colors. These methods are implemented in terms of a handful of protected abstract methods. A subclass need only override the protected abstract methods (getPrimary1, getPrimary2, getPrimary3, getSecondary1, getSecondary2, and getSecondary3); although a subclass may override the other public methods for more control over the set of colors that are used.

Concrete implementations of MetalTheme must return non-null values from all methods. While the behavior of returning null is not specified, returning null will result in incorrect behavior.

It is strongly recommended that subclasses return completely opaque colors. To do otherwise may result in rendering problems, such as visual garbage.
